faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Answers to the most popular questions about admission

home.q1: Is it mandatory to know Turkish for admission?
home.a1: No, knowledge of Turkish is not mandatory. Many programs are conducted in English. If your language level is insufficient, you can take a preparatory year to learn Turkish or English.
home.q2: Do I need to take YÖS or SAT for admission?
home.a2: For most programs, YÖS and SAT are not mandatory. Many universities accept students based on high school certificates and internal exams. However, having high YÖS/SAT scores can increase your chances of getting a scholarship.
home.q3: What is the cost of education and living?
home.a3: Tuition fees vary from $2,500 to $15,000 per year depending on the university and program. Dormitory accommodation: $1,500-3,000 per year. Food and other expenses: about $2,000-4,000 per year.
home.q4: What documents are needed for admission?
home.a4: Main documents: certificate with translation, passport, photos, motivation letter, medical certificate, income statement. All documents must be notarized and translated into Turkish or English.
home.a5: Yes! Various types of scholarships are available: academic (up to 75%), sports (up to 50%), early application (up to 25%). There are also government scholarships Türkiye Bursları for international students.

faq.question1: How much do your services cost?
faq.answer1: The cost depends on the selected service package. Basic package from $500, full support from $1200. We provide installments.
faq.question2: What documents are needed for admission?
faq.answer2: Main documents: certificate/diploma with translation, passport, photos, motivation letter. Full list depends on the chosen university.
faq.question3: Can I apply without knowing Turkish?
faq.answer3: Yes, many universities offer programs in English. There are also preparatory language courses.
faq.answer4: The process takes 2 to 6 months depending on the university and application timing.
faq.answer5: We guarantee admission to one of the selected universities if all requirements are met, or we return the money.
faq.question6: Do you help with housing in Turkey?
faq.answer6: Yes, we help with finding and booking accommodation: dormitories, apartment rentals, host families.
